thread.title: England poised to unleash 'beast' Ellis Genge on Six Nations rivals after injury bug bites their props
thread.title_full: England poised to unleash 'beast' Ellis Genge on Six Nations rivals after injury bug bites their props

author: Alex Spink
title: England poised to unleash 'beast' Ellis Genge on Six Nations rivals after injury bug bites their props
text:
Sport England poised to unleash 'beast' Ellis Genge on Six Nations rivals after injury bug bites their props Fiery Leicester loosehead dropped from Eddie Jones' elite squad last month is putting a marker down as a potential replacement for crocks Mako Vunipola and Joe Marler Share Youngster Genge is getting rave reviews — and giving Eddie Jones food for thought (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Ellis Genge has been hailed as a “beast” of a prop, after making a spectacular late claim for Six Nations inclusion. 
Genge is the fiery young Leicester loosehead so admired by England coach Eddie Jones, yet surprisingly axed from the Aussie's elite squad on New Year’s Eve. 
But Jones might just be having second thoughts after watching the 21-year-old’s scrum masterclass against Premiership leaders Wasps on Sunday. 
Last year's Grand Slam winners have injuries to their two first-choice looseheads. 
Mako Vunipola is ruled out until at least the end of February with damaged knee ligaments, and his understudy Joe Marler is awaiting the result of scans on a calf injury which forced him out of Harlequins’ game on Saturday. Prop Genge flies into a tackle against Exeter on Christmas Eve (Photo: Getty) 
That leaves Bath’s Nathan Catt and Wasps’ Matt Mullan as the only two standing, but neither has caught the eye the way Genge did at the weekend. 
“Ellis has grown each week. Every game he plays, he gets better,” said Leicester coach Aaron Mauger. “He is a very physical, powerful beast. 
“When you need a bit of front-foot ball, he is one of those guys who puts his hand up and carries the ball well. Vunipola is set to miss at least three of England's five games with a knee injury... (Photo: Getty) ...and first-reserve Marler is sweating on a calf problem that stopped him playing on Saturday 
“He’s really maturing and starting to understand his role within the team framework. We are pretty happy with his performance.” 
Wasps boss Dai Young, capped 54 times at prop by Wales and the British & Irish Lions, agreed the youngster goes from “strength to strength”. 
Jones has long rated Genge, whom he capped against Wales in May before selecting him for the summer tour of Australia after just 121 minutes of top-flight rugby. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
